thread.title: Prep football: Springville runs through Wasatch, 27-17
thread.title_full: Prep football: Springville runs through Wasatch, 27-17 | The Salt Lake Tribune

title: Prep football: Springville runs through Wasatch, 27-17
text:
Heber City • His hamstring healed, Springville's Scott Averett ran wild on Wasatch.
The senior tailback, who was limited by injury the previous two weeks, scored a career-high four touchdowns and rushed for a game-high 146 yards in the visiting Red Devils' 27-17 Region 8 victory Friday against Wasatch.
Springville (7-0, 3-0) took over sole possession of first place in the region with three games to play.
"It was good, probably, to sit out a couple of weeks, but it was great to be back out on the field," said Averett, who ran for 118 yards after halftime. 
  The victory was made more impressive by the fact that Springville was whistled for 16 of the game's 18 penalties.
Senior defensive lineman Adam Rodriguez was impressive on the defensive side of the ball, with three sacks — including two on back-to-back plays in the fourth quarter — and a tackle for loss.
"Our coach set up the twist, and our D-tackle took the guard and the tackle with him, and I went up free," Rodriguez said of his final two sacks.
Springville also intercepted two Garrett Davis passes — the second, by Brennen Rymer, swung momentum late in the third quarter and led to Averett's fourth TD run.
"We told him it was a big night tonight and we needed him," Springville coach Willy Child said. "He came up big. Our offensive line and him were huge tonight."
Averett, who entered the game with 172 yards, broke a 58-yard run after Rymer's interception. He scored on a pair of 6-yard runs in the first half, and added scores of 3- and 2- yards in the third quarter.
BYU-bound Skyler Southam kicked a 53-yard field goal for Wasatch (5-2, 2-1) in the third quarter and Davis scored on a 5-yard scramble in the fourth quarter.
